monthly_spend_analysis_data.ai_summary: Your total income for January was $2,345.67, primarily from retirement/pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($200.75, 8.6% of income), medical ($195, 8.3%), entertainment ($35.99, 1.5%), transportation ($65.3, 2.8%), and utilities ($89.99, 3.8%). Your total spending was $586.03 (25% of income). To achieve your goal of paying off student loans, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment and dining out. Look for opportunities to lower medical and transportation costs as well.

Your total income for February was $2,345.67, primarily from a retirement pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($181.77, 7.7% of income), restaurants ($75.50, 3.2%), department stores ($129.99, 5.5%), transportation ($65.00, 2.8%), and medical expenses ($165.99, 7.1%). Your total spending was $618.25, accounting for 26.3% of your income. To better manage your finances and achieve your goal of paying off student loans, consider reducing discretionary spending on dining out and shopping. Additionally, explore options to lower medical expenses if possible. Maintaining a budget and monitoring your spending can help you allocate funds more effectively towards your financial goals.

Your total income for March was $2,345.67, primarily from retirement or pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($140.57, 6% of income), utilities ($270, 11.5% of income), and medical expenses ($134.99, 5.8% of income). Your total spending was $645.31 (27.5% of income). To achieve your goal of paying off student loans, consider reducing discretionary spending on restaurants, entertainment, and personal care. Explore balance transfer credit cards or loan consolidation to lower interest rates on existing debt.

Your total income for April was $2,345.67, primarily from retirement or pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($125.89), restaurants ($65.32), utilities ($205.67), and transportation ($42.15). While your spending on essentials like food and utilities seems reasonable, you could optimize your entertainment and dining out expenses to better align with your goal of paying off student loans. Consider cooking more meals at home and limiting restaurant visits. Additionally, explore cost-effective entertainment options beyond streaming services.
